meanings.definition: Incorrectly attributing something to a source or person.
meanings.sent1: The misattributions of the painting led to confusion in the art world.
meanings.sent2: She made misattributions about who left the note on her desk.
meanings.sent3: The misattributions in the detective's report turned out to be quite comical.
meanings.sent4: His misattributions were like following a map with all the wrong directions.
meanings.sent5: The misattributions in the history book made it hard to trust its accuracy.

meanings.definition: Mistakenly assigning credit or blame to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The misattributions of success often overlook the hard work of others.
meanings.sent2: His misattributions of failure caused unnecessary tension in the team.
meanings.sent3: The misattributions of the cat knocking over the vase made for a funny story.
meanings.sent4: Her misattributions were like trying to fit a square peg into a round hole.
meanings.sent5: The misattributions of the chef's skills left everyone amazed at the true talent behind the dishes.
